Name: Stela of Libation
Description: This round-topped stela, an upright stone with a sculpted surface, depicts a man with a shaven head wearing a kilt. He is tall with relatively thin arms and legs. He pours libation water on a mummy from a special type of vessel. Water was used in mortuary cults as an offering and for purification. A wavy line indicates the water flowing from the mouth of the vessel to surround the mummy. The mummified person is in a position imitating Osiris; his hands are crossed on his chest and he is wearing a curled false beard. Before him is an offering table. In front of the man, a small column bears Hieratic text.
